Uncontrolled Mind Becomes Weak.--The mental powers should be developed to the utmost; they should be strengthened and ennobled by dwelling upon spiritual truths. If the mind is allowed to run almost entirely upon trifling things and the common business of everyday life, it will, in accordance with one of its unvarying laws, 

422 

become weak and frivolous, and deficient in spiritual power.--5T 272 (1885).
